section.title: Fixing a MySQL cluster that has lost a quorum
section.p: If the MySQL cluster on the controller nodes has lost quorum because one node has a crashed mysqld, you may need to recover it by manually specifying which node needs to take over as the primary node. mysqld may be running on the last node, but if the cluster is compromised then all mysql commands will return "unknown command."
To be able to restart the missing instance and have it join in the proper role, you'll need do the following:

li.p: Stop mysql on all controller nodes
Find the sequence number on all nodes (seqno is the sequence number):

codeblock.codeph:
$ sudo cat /mnt/state/var/lib/mysql/grastate.dat
# GALERA saved state version: 2.1 uuid: 5bd38b4a-70e9-11e4-ad52-7647a787e29a seqno: 1419441 cert_index:

li.p: The sequence number may be specified as -1 :

codeblock.codeph: $ sudo cat /mnt/state/var/lib/mysql/grastate.dat GALERA saved state version: 2.1 uuid: 5bd38b4a-70e9-11e4-ad52-7647a787e29a seqno: -1 cert_index:

li.p: In this case run the following command to find the sequence number (mysql service must be stopped to run this). The output is below.

codeblock.codeph:
$ sudo /usr/bin/mysqld_safe --wsrep-recover
---------------------------------------------
141127 12:30:18 mysqld_safe Logging to '/mnt/state/var/log/mysql/error.log'. 141127 12:30:18 mysqld_safe Starting mysqld daemon with databases from /mnt/state/var/lib/mysql/ 141127 12:30:18 mysqld_safe Skipping wsrep-recover for 5bd38b4a-70e9-11e4-ad52-7647a787e29a:1420242 pair 141127 12:30:18 mysqld_safe Assigning 5bd38b4a-70e9-11e4-ad52-7647a787e29a:1420242 to wsrep_start_position 141127 12:30:21 mysqld_safe mysqld from pid file /var/run/mysqld/mysqld.pid ended

li.p: Start mysql on the node with the highest sequence number
Tell the cluster that this node is the bootstrap host
Start mysql on the other controller nodes
